Package manito.eft.interfaces

Interface EPSCore

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EPSCore_1_1, EPSCore_1_2, EPSCore_1_3, EPSCore_1_4, EPSCore_1_5, EPSCore_1_6
    public interface EPSCore
    EFT implementation methods for fulfilling POS requests.

    This is the interface that must be implemented by any EFT subsystem/plugin to make it accessible from the Torex OPI Router package.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1031307 $ $Date: 2020-12-10 18:04:15 +0000 (Thu, 10 Dec 2020) $ $Author: idwillia $
    Author:
    nigel.parish

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      static int DAY_END
      reconciliation with closure
      static int SHIFT_END
      reconciliation without closure

    • Field Detail

      • SHIFT_END

        static final int SHIFT_END
        reconciliation without closure
        See Also:

        reconciliation with closure
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Request for the identification name and version of the core implementation.

        This may need to be displayed to confirm that an authorised EFT system is being used.

        Returns:
        String - identification name and version of the core implementation.

      • init

        void init​(EPSHost host,
          String[] params,
          EPSProperties properties)
        Initialise the object and establish a reference for the EPSHost (POS) connection.
        Parameters:
        host - EPSHost - host system
        params - String [] - parameters from invocation line or null if none
        properties - EPSProperties - property collection

      • logon

        EPSResult logon​(String posID,
                String operatorID)
        Request from the POS to logon to the EPS.

        The use of this method is POS dependent. This method and also logoff() may be directly tied to operator sign-on and sign-off, or there may just be one call to logon at power-up.

        This also identifies the POS to the core, providing an ID that may be used to track requests from different POSs.

        Parameters:
        posID - String - identifier for the host POS.
        operatorID - String - identifier for the operator at the host POS.
        Returns:
        EPSResult - result of the operation with any related data.

      • logoff

        EPSResult logoff()
        Request from the POS to logoff from EFT Host.

        The use of this method is POS dependent. This method and also logon(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) may be directly tied to operator sign-on and sign-off, or there may just be one call to logon at power-up.

        Returns:
        EPSResult - result of the operation with any related data.

      • reconciliation

        EPSResult reconciliation​(int reconciliationType)
        Request from the POS to reconcile the EPS.

        There are two reconciliation options: 

            SHIFT_END - show running totals
    DAY_END - close period/shift and show totals
        Typically, formatted totals will be sent to the POS for printing, though these could be stored for later review via maintenance() or automatically at next logon.
        This may cause the EPS application to logoff from its EFT Host.
        Parameters:
        reconciliationType - int - type of reconciliation, with or without closure
        Returns:
        EPSResult - result of the operation with any related data.

      • maintenance

        void maintenance()
        Request from the POS to enter maintenance mode.

        Typically, a menu should be presented to the operator to select from a list of possible maintenance operations. These may operations such as "reprint last voucher", "show software version number", "print EFT report". Menus can be used in conjunction with other POS device requests to build an interactive maintenance suite.

      • authorise

        EPSResult authorise​(EPSRequest request)
        Request from the POS to authorise an eft action.

        This operation is blocking for the duration of the authorisation. The POS can handle display/input requests while waiting for authorisation reqpose.

        Parameters:
        request - EPSRequest - all data relating to the request.
        Returns:
        EPSResult - result of the operation with any related data.

      • posTransactionInProgress

        void posTransactionInProgress​(boolean transactionInProgress)
        Report from the POS that a transaction is / is not in progress.

        Some EPS systems allow partial card authorisation (also known as card pre-fetch) while the transaction is still in progress to speed up the final authorisation time. To be able to do this, the EPS must track the transaction ststus of the POS.

        Parameters:
        transactionInProgress - boolean - whether a transaction is currently in progress at the POS

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Application is closing.

        To allow interface to be shut down in a controlled manner, clsing ports, sockets etc.

      • abort

        void abort()
        Abort request received from POS.

        If possible the current operation should be aborted with a response code of "Failure" or "Aborted".

      • getCapReversal

        boolean getCapReversal()
        Check whether the core supports Reversal transactions.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if reversals are supported.

      • getCapManualPAN

        boolean getCapManualPAN()
        Check whether the core supports manually enetered card details.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if manually enetered card details can be accepted.
